intro: Asphodeline capillaris, commonly known as the slender asphodel, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and tall spikes of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is drought-tolerant and often found in Mediterranean climates. Its botanical features make it a hardy ornamental plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
